author: Special Correspondent
text:
A biomethanation-cum-power generation plant was commissioned at Vendipalayam dump yard by the Erode Corporation on Friday.— PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

A biomethanation-cum-power generation plant was commissioned by the Corporation at its Vendipalayam dump yard for recycling biodegradable wastes.

The facility was inaugurated by Mayor Malliga Paramasivam.

The plant has a capacity to process 10 metric tonnes of garbage on a daily basis. The city with a jurisdiction of 109.52 sq. km. encompassing 60 wards has a population of 4,98,121 as per 2011 census.

According to the Corporation sources, about 200 tonnes of garbage is generated on a daily basis in the city limits. Vegetable wastes, leaves, food and discarded meat will be recycled at the plant to be operated by Pune-based M/s Mailhem Engineers P Ltd

The Rs. 1.6-crore facility was sanctioned for the Municipal Administration and Water Supply Department under the Solid Waste Management Programme during 2013. Power sourced from the plant would generate Rs. 36 lakh revenue per annum for the City Corporation, the sources said.
title: Biomethanation plant commissioned
